Sequence Information.Peptide Name: PMAP-23R (PMAP-23 L5R, synthetic AMPs, Arg-rich, UCLL1)
Sequence Information.Source: amino acid substitution, pig cathelicidin analog, animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (95.65%) toPMAP-23R: 26%, V: 17%.Activity: Active against S. aureus ATCC 25923 (MIC 0.025 ug/ml), S. epidermidis LY8 (MIC 25 ug/ml), L. monocytogenes CICC 21533 (MIC 125 ug/ml), B. subtilis CICC 24434 (MIC 1.56 ug/ml), S. enterica serovar Choleraesuis C78-1 or serovar Typhimurium SL1344 (MIC 0.78-1.56 ug/ml), P. multocida C48-3 (MIC 1.56 ug/ml), enterotoxigenic E. coli E44813 (MIC 12.5 ug/ml), and S. flexneri CICC 21534 (MIC 75 ug/ml).Antimicrobial robustness: Boiling 1-2 h slightly reduced peptide activity.In vitro toxicity: murine RBC: 4% hemolysis even at 1000 ug/ml, not hemo.lytic.Animal model:mouse: after daily treatment for 3 days, slightly protected mice from death due to S. aureus infection (IP).
Literature Information.Author: Liu Y, Shen T, Chen L, Zhou J, Wang C. 2021
Literature Information.Title: Analogs of the Cathelicidin-Derived Antimicrobial Peptide PMAP-23 Exhibit Improved Stability and Antibacterial Activity.
